AIHordeHeartbeatRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
AlchemyAsyncRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The list of forms (types of post-processing/interrogation/captioning/etc) to request.
The public URL of the source image or a base64 string to use.
Whether to use the slower workers. Costs additional kudos if `False`.
AlchemyDeleteRequest: The UUID for this job. Use this to post the results in the future.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
AlchemyJobSubmitRequest: The UUID for this job. Use this to post the results in the future.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The result of the alchemy job.
The state of this generation. See `GENERATION_STATE` for more information.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The name of the request. This is used to identify the request in the logs.
The usernames that should be prioritized for this request.
The types of alchemy that should be generated.

HordeStatusModelsAllRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The type of model to filter by.
Filter only models that have at least this amount of threads serving.
Filter only models that have at most this amount of threads serving.

If 'known', only show stats for known models in the model reference. If 'custom' only show stats for custom
models. If 'all' shows stats for all models.
HordeStatusModelsSingleRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The name of the model to request.
ImageGenerateAsyncRequest:
When true, only trusted workers will serve this request. When False, Evaluating workers will also be used
which can increase speed but adds more risk!
When True, allows slower workers to pick up this request. Disabling this incurs an extra kudos cost.

A list of worker IDs to use for this request. If empty, any worker can pick up the request. Using this incurs
and extra kudos cost.
If true, the worker list will be treated as a blacklist instead of a whitelist.
The generative models to use for this request.
If true, the request will not be processed, but will return a response with the estimated kudos cost.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The prompt which will be sent to Stable Diffusion to generate an image.
The parameters for the image generation.
Set to true if this request is NSFW. This will skip workers which censor images.
If the request is SFW, and the worker accidentally generates NSFW, it will send back a censored image.
If True, the image will be sent via cloudflare r2 download link.

If True, The image will be shared with LAION for improving their dataset. This will also reduce your
kudos consumption by 2. For anonymous users, this is always True.
If enabled, suspicious prompts are sanitized through a string replacement filter instead.
The public URL of the source image or a base64 string to use.
If source_image is provided, specifies how to process it.

If source_processing is set to 'inpainting' or 'outpainting', this parameter can be optionally provided as the
Base64-encoded webp mask of the areas to inpaint. If this arg is not passed, the inpainting/outpainting mask has to
be embedded as alpha channel.
Additional uploaded images which can be used for further operations.
ImageGenerateCheckRequest: The UUID for this job. Use this to post the results in the future.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
ImageGenerateJobPopRequest: The number of jobs to pop at the same time.
The worker name, version and website.
The models this worker can generate.
Whether this worker can generate NSFW requests or not.
The usernames that should be prioritized by this worker.
If True, this worker will only pick up requests where the owner has the required kudos to consume already available.
How many threads this worker is running. This is used to accurately the current power available in the horde.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The version of the bridge this worker is running.
The maximum number of pixels this worker can generate.
The list of words this worker will not accept in a prompt.
Whether this worker can generate img2img.
Whether this worker can generate inpainting/outpainting.
Whether this worker will generate from unsafe/VPN IP addresses.
Whether this worker can do post-processing.
Whether this worker can generate using controlnets.
Whether this worker can generate using SDXL controlnets.
Whether this worker can generate using Loras.
ImageGenerateStatusRequest: The UUID for this job. Use this to post the results in the future.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
ImageGenerationJobSubmitRequest: The UUID for this job. Use this to post the results in the future.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
R2 result was uploaded to R2, else the string of the result.
If True, this resulting image has been censored.
Extra metadata about faulted or defaulted components of the generation

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The state of the models to get stats for. Known models are models that are known to the system.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
KudosTransferRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The username of the user to transfer Kudos to.
The amount of Kudos to transfer.
ListUsersDetailsRequest:
The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The page number to request. There are up to 25 users per page.
The field to sort the users by. The default is by kudos.
ModifyUserRequest: Add further information about this user for the other admins.
The amount of concurrent request this user can have.

Contact details for the horde admins to reach the user in case of emergency. This is only visible to horde
moderators.

When set to true, the user will be able to serve custom Stable Diffusion models which do not exist in the
Official AI Horde Model Reference.
When set to true, the user is considered an education account and some options become more restrictive.
When set to true, the replacement filter will always be applied against this user
When set to true, the user cannot transfer kudos and all their workers are put into permanent maintenance.
Set to true to make this user a horde moderator.
When specified, will start assigning the user monthly kudos, starting now!
Set to true to make this user display their worker IDs.
When set to true, the user is considered a service account proxying the requests for other users.
When set to true, The user can send special payloads.
When set to true,the user and their servers will not be affected by suspicion.
The amount by which to multiply the users kudos consumption.
When specified, will change the username. No profanity allowed!

When set to true, the user will be able to onboard workers behind a VPN. This should be used as a temporary
solution until the user is trusted.
Set to the amount of workers this user is allowed to join to the horde when in worker invite-only mode.
The amount of kudos to modify (can be negative).
Set the user's suspicion back to 0.
The user's ID, as a `str`, but only containing numeric values.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
ModifyWorkerRequest: The UUID of the worker in question for this request.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
You can optionally provide a server note which will be seen in the server details. No profanity allowed!
Set to true to put this worker into maintenance.

If maintenance is True, you can optionally provide a message to be used instead of the default maintenance
message, so that the owner is informed.
When this is set, it will change the worker's name. No profanity allowed!
(Mods only) Set to true to pause this worker.
The team towards which this worker contributes kudos.  It an empty string ('') is passed, it will leave the

TextGenerateAsyncRequest:
When true, only trusted workers will serve this request. When False, Evaluating workers will also be used
which can increase speed but adds more risk!
When True, allows slower workers to pick up this request. Disabling this incurs an extra kudos cost.

A list of worker IDs to use for this request. If empty, any worker can pick up the request. Using this incurs
and extra kudos cost.
If true, the worker list will be treated as a blacklist instead of a whitelist.
The generative models to use for this request.
If true, the request will not be processed, but will return a response with the estimated kudos cost.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
The parameters to use for the generation.
The prompt which will be sent to KoboldAI to generate text.

When true and the request requires upfront kudos and the account does not have enough The request will be
downgraded in max context and max tokens so that it does not need upfront kudos.

When true, This request will not use batching. This will allow you to retrieve accurate seeds.
Feature is restricted to Trusted users and Patreons.
Any extra source images that should be used for this request; e.g., for multi-modal models.

If using a service account as a proxy, provide this value to identify the actual account from which this
request is coming from.
Specify which softprompt needs to be used to service this request.

Provide a URL where the AI Horde will send a POST call after each delivered generation.
The request will include the details of the job as well as the request ID.

The maximum amount of tokens this worker can generate.
The max amount of context to submit to this AI for sampling.
The available softprompt files on this worker for the currently running model.

The requesting client's agent. You should set this to reflect the name, version and contact information
for your client.
